content:
0, 2016
												This game reminds me of those token-sucking arcade basketball machines. I can see VR games like this inevitably replacing those machines. Like's:- The game modes are fairly fun. All easy to pick up and start playing.- Physics are very well done. Things like velocity, arc, and release all translate really well.- Love the little "enter initials" game. Nice touch!- You actually get a pretty decent workout!- This game is everything Wii Sports wished it could be.- I have a new go-to for demoing the Vive.Dislike's:- No music- Needs more difficulties - "Garbage" mode is a bit glitchy. Items disappear mid-throw.- When the ball is on fire, it's a bit distracting and screws up your aim.- I wish the controller models were hand models instead.Here's some of my gameplay!


YouTube™ Video: MR.VR ► Hoops VR (HTC Vive) Gameplay | No Commentary! 

			Views: 3,210		

			KOBE!!! This game reminds me of those token-sucking arcade basketball machines. I can see VR games like this inevitably replacing those machines.

content:
1, 2016
												Only basketball game available. It is well done and plenty of room for additions. I hope you have high ceilings.Would like to see an accurate display of the collision instead of vive controllers to make it easier to do tricks outside of the normal gameplay. Not sure if this is just some effect of VR or a game problem but the balls feel "heavier" than they should to me. I feel like I'm putting in a lot more effort than I would IRL.In Garbage mode, all the food based assets seems to LOD out and vanish about 3 feet from the camera but they still count if the invisible fruit makes it in. Not sure if this is some sort of blind shot feature to prevent correction or a bug.

Product received for free
												This is the first basketball game for the Vive and it is a ton of fun. Think of it as one of those basketball arcade games but on steroids. Graphics/sounds/phyics are all very well done. Unlike a lot of other early access games this does have a global/friends leader board which is nice to see.Some things that can be improved upon or added - After hitting 3 shots consecutively the flames on the ball can be very distracting and make the follow up shots that more difficult. If anything maybe it would be good to have the flame shots worth a extra point. The time remaining should following you around instead of having to find it in the arena.The developers are off to a great start. I'm looking forward to see where they take this one.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2016
												Firstly, this does not feel like shooting hoops does in real life - without the weight of a basketball or the use of two hands to grip one ball it feels and behaves completely different, and it's physics feel very different to a basketball. One of the first things I noticed was that the hoops were all quite low (many of them even spawn below you), but this is really necessary due to the way physics behave without the weight of a basketball or proper throwing technique.Having said that, it's still a lot of fun, and I don't regret buying this for a second. If you want to throw balls into hoops, or garbage into bins, or paper planes into hoops I'd recommend it - it's fairly well polished and makes for a good distraction for a while.Disclaimer: I suck at basketball in real life and probably don't know what I'm talking about here.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
1, 2016
												Really fun and addicting. Just picked it up and started playing, next thing I knew I've been going at it for over an hour and I'm dripping in sweat lol. Pros:-Addicting-Simple yet kept my interest for an hour straight (didn't even move past easy yet)-Scoreboard is nice (Reason why I didn't go past easy yet is because I wanted the high score first!)-Controls are very simple-Small, almost meaningless feature...but I really like how you can dribble the ball and try for bounce shots or just volleyball spike it for fun!Cons:-Lack of music. Sure I can play my own music, but a nice tune in the background would be nice! I think I could get even more into it if there was.-I dislike how a hoop can come up right in front of another and block your shot. It almost punishes you for scoring too quickly-The fire from the ball can block your vision a bit. Would be nice to see it tuned down a bit (Though I love how the ball lights on fire. Reminds me of NBA Street lol)That's really all the cons I got. Fun game, worth the $9-10. Simple yet addicting and fun!

content:
8, 2016
												Very interesting game, but personally I just can't get used to basketball without the weight of the ball. Beyond that, 4 game modes, easy, hard (smaller nets), trash (random shaped trash into trash cans) and planes (paper airplanes through hoops). After 3 baskets in a row, objects become flaming, which is kind of neat but ultimately just distracting. In paper airplane, aiming it is very annoying because they are so large it takes up half the field of view. All modes are timed, which I dislike as well, would be nice to just free play to practice the mechanics, but ultimately nothing really making me want to go back.

ber 12, 2016
												This game is outstanding -- I cannot stop playing.  The game is simple but the environment is classic arcade and the physics are on point.  I'd love a few more game types (maybe realtime versus multiplayer or a "longshot" challenge/waves where the hoops get progressively further away, etc.), but I'd pay 5 times the price at the moment.  I'll be playing this for years.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 11, 2016
												This is a fun arcade-style game with global scoreboards that motivate me to keep coming back. The graphics are good, the environment provides a real sensation of presence (the platform you shoot from is something your brain will instinctively want to avoid the edge of), and the trajectories of the balls/objects feel appropriate for the input (more so than most other games where you throw stuff).The only thing I'd like that the game is lessened by the lack of is the ability to re-orient the playspace. Currently, it forces you to play in a specific direction, which for me means risking banging my controller on furniture as I have a small space. In spite of this, I've thus far done pretty well on the leaderboards, so if you're in a similar situation it's a disadvantage that won't hamper you too much.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
7
												Look, have you ever wanted to know what it feels like to be Michael Jordan in his prime, but you're a neckbeard living in your parents basement with the fitness level of a sloth? Or have you ever wanted to feel like one of those trick shot guys without wanting to edit highlight videos all day? Then this game is for you. I straight up played this game for so long I couldn't lift my arms. I'm writing this review with my nose! The game is fun, simple and challenging enough to make you cry while starting again to break your last score. Definitely worth the money. Cabbages being launched through the air hasn't been this good since Avatar: The Last Airbender. MY CABBAGESSSS!

content:
18
												Better than I expected, and something that I certainly will be playing again with friends to challenge each others scores.  Actually quite a decent fun VR 'arcade' game.  Obviously it's not a deep strategy game that you're going to spend 100s of hours playing, but it does a good job of being what it is.Physics seem good; bounces, angles, and gravity all seeme to behave. Trash and paper airplanes are okay, but I can't see myself going back to play them much.  The hoops on the other hand - will be played - esp, if friends beat my scores.  Which bring up something missing... challenges.  Leader boards are one thing, and having friends challenge for scores is also good.  But, I think the addition of some unlocks for beating scores would certainly add to the solo-play longevity of the game.   Obvious ideas for unlocks would be different balls, wrist bands, controller models, ... lots of possibilties there, I think.  Devs?? :-)Overall - thumbs up for a fun, but not deep, basketball shooting game.  As mentioned in other reviews - if you enjoy arcade basketball (the real one, not digital), then you'll probably like this too.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
0, 2016
												For what it is worth, this game is a nice distraction in VR.  What it does well:   Has local Leaderboards, Friend Leaderboards, and Global Leaderboards (so that any guest can get their initials in the game and compete with you arcade style) Very simple gameplay, with 4 modes:  Easy, Hard, Paper Airplanes through hoops, and garbage in garbage cans Achievements are fair but hard.  Very doable in a few hours, although the Hard Achievement will take a lot of practice Addictive Repeative Gameplay loop Great graphics for what it is +2 points for going on fire! What it does poorly:   Ball physics are not like a real ball (you can't really put backspin on the ball)  The weight of the balls feel off at first... but you get used to it.  The weight makes it hard to put a high arc on the ball.  If you have ever played the Wii Sports basketball game, I am not sure waht they did differently, but that mode felt more right than this as far as feeling like you shooting basketballs with a sense of real motion.  If you can get past the "realism" factor though, and learn the physics of the game... it's still fun  Hard modes are mostly easier if you play underhand than overhand because of the limits of VR Overall, this was a great addition to my VR library, and I go back to it often enough to try and beat achievements and/or beat my own highscores.  When people try VR, this is a great one to break out if they like sports and/or if they like trying to beat scores.   For wahtever reason, everyone really likes the garbage can mode the most.As a sidenote to other developers of VR, local leaderboards are a must.
